text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
dot-com with coconut rice that's right
with the weather warming up we've
already done a few grilled meats videos
and we'll definitely do a few more but
today I thought I would show something
that would make a perfect side dish for
those grilled manners and that would be
this amazing and very easy to make
savory coconut rice and I say savory so
it's not to be confused with those sweet
coconut Rice's which while delicious are
way closer to a dessert for me all right
we are going to get a little bit of
natural sweetness from the coconut but
unlike some versions this is not going
to rival our strawberry shortcake in
sweetness so with that let's go ahead
and get started by dumping some jasmine
rice into a heavy-bottomed saucepan and
while jasmine rice is what I'm
recommending here any longer in rice
should work and then besides the rice
we're also going to need some finely and
freshly grated ginger as well as some
red chili flakes and if those look
different it's because I'm not using the
Italian style I'm using Korean chili
flakes which don't have any seeds and
then we'll also toss in a little spoon
of turmeric which is going to warm up
the color of our rice Plus apparently
Toomer prevents every major disease
known to man oh yeah I read that on
Twitter and then we'll finish up our
seasonings with some salt before moving
on to our two liquid ingredients the
first of which would be some nice fresh
cold water and then last but not least
we'll go ahead and dump in one can of
coconut milk and set our heat to
medium-high because we want to bring
this up to a simmer and by the way you
only get to stir this once okay we don't
want to continue to stir this as it
comes up to a simmer as that could mess
with our texture okay so get in there
with your whisk and stir it until it's
just combined and then stop so we will
give that a quick stir and then simply
stand there waiting for it to simmer and
when we see little bubbles happening
around the edge we know we're getting
close and as soon as our mixture
actually starts to simmer we need to
quickly do three things we need to toss
one bay leaf on top we need to cover
this tightly and reduce our heat to low
because what we're going to need to do
is let this cook on low for exactly 18
minutes and if you're thinking we should
probably peek at that in stir it a few
times well your instincts are terrible
we need you to leave this alone for
exactly 18 minutes but once this cooks
for 18 minutes undisturbed on low
we still don't peek or stir it no we're
just going to turn off the heat and set
our timer for five minutes I know you
want to see it but you already went in
18 minutes
you can wait five more and then finally
once it rings we can uncover it and take
a look but more importantly fluff it
with a fork now we're simply doing this
to break that rice up in separate the
grains so we are only briefly forking
this until that happens okay if you keep
stirring what's going to happen is
you're going to rub starch off and the
mixture is going to get stickier which
by the way I should mention if you want
to stick here keep stirring but that's
good enough for me and then assuming
that's tasting like you want which you
will be we can go ahead and transfer
that to a serving bowl and then for a
final touch maybe we'll finish with some
toasted coconuts and that's it my take
on coconut rice is done and yes of
course if you want to go ahead and
garnish this with some herbs like
cilantro or maybe some sliced green
onions go ahead you are after all the
vincent price of your coconut rice so do
not be frightened to adapt this as you
see fit but anyway let me grab a fork
and dig in so I can brag about how
perfect the texture came out and that's
grains of rice that have kind of a
sticky tacky surface but they remain
separate and not all come together which
is exactly what we have here but who
cares about texture and appearance if it
doesn't taste good which I'm happy to
report it does as I mentioned in the
intro what we're going for here is a
savory rice side dish with just a little
bit of sweetness and for me this has
just the right balance be sure the stuff
is so tasty you could just eat it as is
but what's an even better idea is to
enjoy with those beautiful grilled
summer meats like for example this
amazing hoisin beef which there's a very
good chance I'm going to show you how to
make but whether you enjoy this with a
juicy grilled piece of skirt steak or
with some barbeque chicken or maybe so
sweet smoky ribs no matter what you pair
this with I really do hope you give it a
try soon so head over to food wishes
comm for all the ingredient amounts and
more info as usual and as always enjoy
you
